document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

DF967C4744774DD1A148F7A5AE22DEAC.description:
Share information orally in writing, or through visual display, avoiding plagiarism and
using own words.

8F633A46E9CE481998A9616AEC14694E.description:
Record information on sources using own words, organizing evidence into provided
categories.

550C07E70A6344C8BEBAED82500FB636.description: Use templates to organize the information collected (e.g., charts, graphs).

FEB81C41229B4A90ACAAD15A43D04134.description: Locate information in reference texts, electronic resources, interviews, or provided sources.

BA7AF3BB17CC4B4BA616597509A73656.description: Identify a topic and generate questions to explore the topic.

345E9502949747249528D945D9B0FCD8.description:
The student will conduct research and read or listen to a series of conceptually related
texts on selected topics to build knowledge on grade-level topics or solve problems using
available resources.

DFC4C0EB481E474288A11567B8340073.description: **Standards related to Examining Media Messages are introduced in Grade Four.

270F7FB383A547CA9A64E9BD36DC5BE5.description: Create a simple presentation using multimodal tools that enhance the topic or presentation.

CEF9880ACF614DE092AE3A989C49DD6B.description: Retell information in an organized manner, focused on a key topic or experience.

B8745841600A4A07AD2D4A688307B96C.description:
Create and participate in oral language activities that include oral storytelling and
dramatics.

32A3137BF40343EBBF7B220FFCA3D438.description: Engage the audience by asking and/or responding to questions.

A18D03F39F1E4D068FB5298E5161F626.description: Speak audibly with appropriate pacing, prosody, and voice level.

61F6161A61694847B68911CCCD65C979.description: Use topic specific language and vocabulary to communicate ideas.

B01EC558DB6B475AB1D1BE338285EAAD.description:
Demonstrating active engagement when listening to a speaker and asking for
clarification to ensure understanding.

40360122C0ED429A89552B56B86F0BD4.description: Asking and responding to questions that acquire or confirm information on a topic.

58A810BF4A8F4C258D8569825E587230.description: Respectfully building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

065DC9B8D07141BA81F35D37C4187190.description: Listening actively and following agreed upon rules for participating in discussions.

3A08E7A76546413F8DCEBAB795EFF217.description:
Participate in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led)
on grade two topics and texts. This includes:

11ACD277A7EB431A9C97F63964B8C799.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

DA108F4607744306A9A29BE32EDCF0E8.description: Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words.

6C320BB49D094EB38554D3BCF8C2635C.description: Use commas in salutation and closing of a letter.

2FDA5A6FDFAA44919D280B9B75C684DD.description:
Identify statements, questions, and commands and use correct ending punctuation (e.g.,
period, question mark, and exclamation points).

3D0EF32098A240B8A93A196352273F99.description: Use subject-verb agreement in simple sentences.

D640DBCDBFB44572B336A2934E82EE15.description:
Use proper verb tense, including for frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., ran, told,
went).

72FB2692C2ED429590C8DE99CF159964.description:
Use frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple relationships (e.g., and, but, or, so,
because).

6601B732DAA642F787C98105A2506B86.description: Form and use regular and frequently occurring irregular plural nouns (e.g., men, teeth).

D9A6B70199044F759A332F6968E7FB9D.description: Use indefinite (e.g., anybody, anything) reflexive (e.g., yourself, herself) pronouns.

D5BD900C511F4923A785A6B241C2087A.description: Produce and expand complete sentences, both simple and compound.

DD5CF76638E942B787428D42181DC263.description:
The student will use conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

B5431AAB89A44D0E87F84BAB6BE50D79.description:
With guidance and support from adults, edit writing for conventions (e.g., spelling,
capitalization, usage, punctuation). (See Language Usage for grade level expectations).

ABB2D62060EE418A81C9B3F0AA33CB86.description:
With guidance and support from adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by
revising for quality of ideas, organization, sentence fluency, and word choice.

CDD4C0CC3D674693AF1DE2248D330879.description: Providing a concluding statement or section.

73CD0B95D77D4115A47860E7E0FF9839.description:
Developing, selecting, and organizing ideas and details relevant to the topic, purpose,
and genre.

21C85AEE25264B609D567C09DEF49F63.description: Identifying the audience and purpose of the writing.

1F1B83BE387E4E808FE3DB179623A6A4.description: Writing a clear topic sentence focusing on the main idea.

D7F17D775B274FBDB51C119F4ACEA764.description: Engage in writing as a process to plan writing based on purpose and genre. This includes:

00A244C667CF4BCF930E09039686FD01.description:
Write in response to text(s) read or heard to share thinking with a couple supporting details
from the text.

58429B043C274A95BDF0DAF2BD760462.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts that support a point of view with reasons.

20A0D60543C44E42ACFABC6E85612C5B.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts that introduce a topic and develop the ideas with facts
and examples.

1417AAE074184F3EB9DD7C743B47A06E.description:
Write narratives that recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events and
include details about the events and characters and use of time-related words to signal the
event sequence.

EDF8A6D981A546129B406BC6B3101A54.description:
The student will write in a variety of forms for diverse audiences and purposes, linked to
grade two content and texts.

92B92D6E99F349EC86AFFB792912927E.description:
Use phoneme/grapheme (sound/symbol) correspondences to encode (spell) grade-level
high-frequency words with automaticity and accuracy.

082D72C448D242F29626A528F760C9B7.description:
Use phoneme-grapheme (sound/symbol) correspondence to encode (spell) multisyllabic
words.

7675969EA7FB4348A0CE6E51C0CEC216.description:
Use phoneme-grapheme (sound/symbol correspondence to encode (spell) single-syllable
words containing closed syllables (cvc, ccvc, cvcc, and ccvcc), open syllables (cv, ccv),
vowel-consonant-e (cvce, ccvce), vowel teams, and r-controlled vowels.

E9F9A8606B3B42408F5E5AA96C5CBBAA.description: Begin to sign his/her first and last names.

402F983879DB43FCBB46EB2D1142CB5E.description: Begin to write capital and lowercase letters of the alphabet in cursive.

CA78B804D6AB4D98AA8C325D9265D562.description: Maintain legible printing and begin to make the transition to cursive.

EBDE5876B2434F9CBE3028DA1866928D.description:
The student will print legibly in manuscript and cursive while applying grade level
word knowledge to spell words correctly.

FEA5988332FB45169C480A8864BB2222.description:
Describe the interactions between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in
texts.

3029ECAD772E49BEB11F33E2F1707A75.description: Compare and contrast the most important points presented by two texts on the same topic.

943D0DC7BB2C43A09B76075013CF899D.description: Use prior (experience) and background (content) knowledge as context for new learning.

F833BEB22CFF4A0DA830B58C6E0C20F5.description:
Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or
describe.

B0402E6836184391A1725C7D529BE32B.description:
Use text features (table of contents, headings, pictures, captions, maps, and charts) to
preview, set a purpose for reading and gain information.

0284D3674DD34920A5586613039D636A.description: Differentiate facts from opinions within a text.

5E90581FE0824A1FA81E20CFF3A93591.description: Retell key details of texts that demonstrate an understanding of the main topics of texts.

EF7A3EAFF8E3442C93AAF3D239DA0669.description:
Ask and answer literal and inferential questions (who, what, where, when, how, and why)
about key details in a text.

04D81B37A4CB4667B44370EC7B5E52BA.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate and build knowledge from a
variety of grade level complex informational texts heard or read.

8DB95CDFD20A4FDE8D998143FCA7C330.description:
Compare and contrast characters, settings, and plots in two versions of the same story from
different cultures (e.g., Cinderella stories).

C4967069D233480097E228D5351AD91E.description:
Recognize dialogue in text and explain how it can reveal characters’ thoughts and
perspectives.

EC9930188D6642AF944EEAA35945F6FC.description:
Set a purpose for reading by providing guiding questions, activating prior (experience) and
background (content) knowledge.

ED9E2CDA78894D4F99FF91DCFBF90F6A.description: **Standards that address Craft and Style begin in Grade Three.

4BD32CD61BC6482F93B7ED1E63FAAD69.description: Generate predictions about story characters and events using the text.

8F25BF17D68A4CCA86B8E89916B5327A.description:
Describe character’s attributes (e.g., traits, motivations, or feelings) and how they respond
to major events and challenges.

A91CD0802E88423EBC3177D38C1BDAB5.description: Identify a story’s central conflict using events from the plot as evidence.

910DC81690354E06B7F609B30D1E8DBB.description:
Retell stories sequentially, including their overall structure, essential story events, and the
central message, lesson, or moral.

C3025D014B44407FA49455257EC18C16.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts heard or read to include
fantasy, humor, fable/fairy tale, realistic fiction, historical fiction, and folklore/tall tale, with
a focus on fables/fairytales from a variety of cultures.

4F5EE7E66F7E4F53B850CF0244EB331D.description: Use newly learned words and phrases in discussions and speaking activities.

BB64F24EE707410CAA9599A1BBD54317.description:
Develop breadth of vocabulary knowledge by listening to and reading high quality,
complex text.

80B96CD120CA4EB5BF2A7AD310B79E93.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs and adjectives.

2147EBB87DE34DFC8F3D9C9B5F798977.description:
Apply knowledge of morphology (e.g., common grade appropriate suffixes, prefixes),
synonyms, and antonyms to determine the meaning of new words.

5391F96F82084E6FB4454345C66898F4.description: Use the context of a sentence to apply knowledge of homophones.

487C65E4E2F14FFA91A0AB881C93BB1F.description:
Determine the meaning of an unknown word using frequently occurring root words and
inflectional affixes (e.g. -s, -ing, - ed).

51A594B94C5E4274BB4F2B6C4DA07B59.description: Discuss meanings of new words or phrases acquired through conversations and literature.

1C93E55129494BBA90682BF5E8617C54.description: The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on gradetwo content and texts heard or read.

C34D01BFC46044F6AC36B082A99D1F8B.description:
Regularly engage in listening to a series of conceptually related texts organized around
topics of study to build knowledge and vocabulary. Use this background knowledge as
context for new learning (Deep Reading on Topics to Build Knowledge and
Vocabulary, K-12).

FB5936C55173420ABE47CA6AF35569BC.description:
When responding to text through discussion and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from read-alouds and grade-level texts to support claims, conclusions, and
inferences, including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where
relevant evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

19DEDCBF057A49AF99B2F65093A844CB.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend texts from a variety of literary forms that exhibit
complexity at the lower range of the grades 2-3 band (See the Quantitative and Qualitative
Analysis charts for determining complexity in the Appendix.) (Text Complexity, 2-12).

962742CBE54C4DD7B1E59EF5F0AC17D1.description:
Read a variety of grade-level text with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate, and
meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor while
reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding as necessary
(Reading Fluency, K-12).

486AC58D10014C228444A34F02BB09FE.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading and
listening to a range of challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and gathering evidence from grade-level complex texts and reading widely (through read alouds)
on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and vocabulary.

2EF1B0B973574D2CAE39ADA6B806430A.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

48665372309C46FD925E3EE0E3B52E94.description:
Read grade-level high frequency words, including decodable and irregular words, with
automaticity and accuracy.

C0DD77A1C05E4E2D8106D3313DE58AC0.description: Use knowledge of affixes (e.g., suffixes, prefixes) to decode words.

4489191A21AA412CB5D39024A993B22C.description: Use knowledge of syllabication and syllable types to decode words.

65FC9BE2D54F45A0A216E96968BBF5DF.description: Decode and encode words with vowel teams and r-controlled vowels.

041238312D6A4D418801A2790727AE04.description:
Decode and encode words with short vowels to include blends, digraphs, and trigraphs in
closed syllables (CVCC, CCVC, CVCC, CCVCC, and CCVCCC) and open syllables (CV,
CCV).

FDDDC7929E454A6FA112448BA76FB681.description:
Phonics and Word Analysis: The student will apply phonetic principles to read and
spell words.

174CCE637DDB49328E5E83183DD7F3A8.description:
Demonstrate the ability to segment words with four and five phonemes, including words with
consonant digraphs (e.g., th, sh, ch) and consonant blends (e.g., fr, st, bl).

E959F88790A44BE68DDC45FC5B1C0A75.description:
Demonstrate the ability to blend words with four and five phonemes, including words with
consonant digraphs (e.g., th, sh, ch) and consonant blends (e.g., fr, st, bl).

A09A110A35144CFDA3D0B6243D6F6269.description: Isolate sounds in four and five phoneme words.

62D92ED269A7443EA204484AC0E4C3E0.description:
Phonological and Phonemic Awareness: The student will orally identify and
produce various phonemes (individual sounds) within words to develop phonemic awareness
in support of decoding (reading) and encoding (spelling).

7E1F8955C1CD4044A2224E9F3CB2494E.description: See Kindergarten for standards that address Print Concepts.
